definition: to be in flood/to overflow (the banks)/to inundate/to spread unchecked
variant of 泛[fan4]
variant of 泛[fan4]
to float/to be suffused with/general/extensive/non-specific/flood/pan- (prefix)
overflowing/excessive/indiscriminate
lit. to flood (idiom)/fig. rampant/in plague proportions

sentences.english: In the tale of the Pied Piper, we have a village overrun with rats.
sentences.chinese: 魔笛的故事里，那个村庄鼠患泛滥。

sentences.english: Letting tax cheats run wild doesn’t exactly serve the cause of deficit reduction.
sentences.chinese: 让骗税泛滥与削减赤字的努力作用刚好相反。

sentences.english: Analysis on the ecological characteristics, there was a flooded plain at that time.
sentences.chinese: 从生态特征分析，当时可能为一泛滥平原。

sentences.english: The area's prodigality of forests has raised its ugly head these years.
sentences.chinese: 这个地区近几年泛滥森林的问题十分突出。

sentences.english: The swollen river washed away the footbridge.
sentences.chinese: 泛滥的河水冲走了人行桥。

sentences.english: The methamphetamine "pervitin" is one of the most widespread drugs in the area because of ease of availability.
sentences.chinese: 脱氧麻黄碱在当地可以轻易获得，因而泛滥成灾。

sentences.english: This kind of thing in coastal areas used more flooding, many in use.
sentences.chinese: 这种东西在沿海地区使用的比较泛滥，很多老千在用。

sentences.english: Some of these overflows have darkened the northwestern flanks.
sentences.chinese: 一些泛滥出的泥浆已经将西北侧山麓染成黑色。

sentences.english: Coupled with the rapid development of information technology, piracy emergences everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 信息业的高速发展，随之而来的是盗版的肆意泛滥。

sentences.english: In 1970, high-grade heroin and opium flooded Southeast Asia.
sentences.chinese: 1970年东南亚的高纯度海洛因和鸦片泛滥成灾。

sentences.english: Poyang Lake helps keep down floods on the Changjiang River.
sentences.chinese: 在汛期，都阳湖有助于制止长江泛滥成灾。

sentences.english: Pandemic flu remains moderate but strikes young: WHO.
sentences.chinese: 甲流未泛滥，但年轻人更易感染。

sentences.english: Will the yellow fever, like the River HuangHe does, bring sorrow to the current regime?
sentences.chinese: 这次的黄潮热会像黄河泛滥一样，令到政权害怕吗？

sentences.english: However, it is best advisable to limit your declarations of love and endearments.
sentences.chinese: 但是我还是要提醒你，切忌你对爱的表达太过泛滥。

sentences.english: The water broke loose when the dam burst.
Infamy was babbling around her in the public market-place.
sentences.chinese: 在公共市场上，她周围泛滥着对她丑行的种种议论。

definition: lit. to flood (idiom)/fig. rampant/in plague proportions
disastrous/to turn into a disaster
to breed/to flourish/to cause/to provoke/to create
to be rampant/to run wild
to be in vogue/to be prevalent
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to grow (usually of abstract things)/to yield/to develop
ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
to extend/to spread
rampant/very popular
(of a watercourse) to breach its dike/(of dikes) to collapse
to submerge/to drown/to flood/to drown out (also fig.)
to induce labor/to expedite childbirth
in the middle of the road/to be in the way/to hold power/(fig.) to predominate/to be in vogue
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
